Articles.Content: i've seen a video from suestragamingHD (Great channel btw) showing a planet with characteristics of jool (As well as other planets) but the planet had a different color.

So which part of what you described made you think it is NOT a mod?

Everything that changes something from vanilla into something else is considered a mod.

If it was not a mod it would be a stock feature, implemented by Squad.

That being said - I will try 3.2 and see if it has a memory leak like 4.0.

This is just what i needed! ands its technically not a mod right?

It is not a mod in that it does not change gamplay. It is not a mod in the sense that you get parts that can do things stock parts can not. It is not a mod if you talk about making things easier for yourself. It is purely graphical, but since you change things, in the strictest sense it is a mod.

But why would you care? It should not be an issue, unless you are competing with people and have a strict no mods whatsoever period rule. If you do not like mods because they make life easy you can still use this one.

That mods make life easy is also a weird notion, as stuff like Lifesupport, FAR, Deadly reentry et cetera make life a lot, lot harder.

Here is a quick shot of my own "Jool-piter" retexture:

Download link. Might have to right click and save-as to download instead of open. Just be sure to drop it in the appropriate folder, I didn't put the texture file inside the subfolder structure.

The OP should put this in the Texture Pack page, This is amazing
I don't know how to install, I extracted all the contents of the two zip files to the directory of my ksp, but when I launch the game nothing has changed...
Have you added a new texture pack?
I downloaded the Universe Replacer, extracted the contents to my ksp directory. Then I downloaded this texture pack and also extracted it in the same directory. Opened the game, nothing had changed.

The texture pack should consist of different images, they each need to go into their corresponding folder under Gamedata\UniverseReplacer\Textures. If you extracted both Universe Replacer and the texture pack into the root KSP directory, then neither of them will do anything.
will changing sliders of terrain in the graphics options do anything with these textures?

I guess I didn't say "thank you" to the creators of Universe Replacer and this awesome texture packs. Together with telescope mods and some minor image editing one can now really admire the beauty of the KSP universe:

Thank you!
hello I have a question: is ksp textures reddit page kept up to date?
Wow.. How did this mod page get no more posts?

Wow.. How did this mod page get no more posts?

It's because the market is saturated. Everyone who can spare the memory has this mod by now and the mod is pretty much perfected with enough textures to please everyone. So there is nothing left to say.

I found some very interesting constellation maps at http://www.davidrumsey.com/luna/servlet/view/search?os=0&q=6900.000&pgs=100&sort=Pub_List_No_InitialSort%2CPub_Date%2CPub_List_No%2CSeries_No It will take some time to crop and format them properly, but I think a skybox like this could be a lot of fun.

It's because the market is saturated. Everyone who can spare the memory has this mod by now and the mod is pretty much perfected with enough textures to please everyone. So there is nothing left to say.
